revised_title: A Study of a Remarkable Spring near Paderborn, Germany
tldr: An inquiring gentleman reports on a triple spring near Paderborn, Germany, with three streams of differing qualities. One stream is bluish, lukewarm, and bubbling, while the other is ice-cold and turbid. Drinking water from the streams causes birds to die, but some men with worms find relief. The third stream is greenish and has a pleasant taste, possibly a mix of the other two.
